content.question: Which of the following best describes a characteristic of <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> that makes it useful as hereditary material?

choices.label: There are many different types of nucleotide bases that can be incorporated into <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The nucleotide bases can also be used to provide the energy needed for reproduction.
Nucleotide bases can be randomly replaced with different nucleotide bases to increase variation.
Nucleotide bases in one strand can only be paired with specific bases in the other strand.

content.answer: Nucleotide bases in one strand can only be paired with specific bases in the other strand.
